ground_truth: Lights burn in the house at night, and he's lying by the fire. He lies down next to Marley as Jenny fetches a blanket for them. Marley is lying under a tree, and he gets out of the car and runs indoors, where Connor gives him a hug. Jenny fights back tears while John takes the stuffed lamb, and Patrick tearfully hugs Marley. The boy looks imploringly at his parents; Jenny frowns in sympathy at her son's pain, and John tries a reassuring smile. He carries Marley out to the car and gently lays the old dog down in the boot. John goes to get behind the wheel as Jenny tearfully strokes her dying pet; she closes the door and presses her hand to the glass as John drives away down the winding drive through trees adorned with golden brown autumn leaves. At the surgery, John sits and waits with his hands clasped together. At home, Patrick is leafing through John's old columns, and Jenny walks in and ruffles his blonde hair. Jenny controls her own emotions as John gives into tears. He goes back into the surgery where Marley is lying on the table, runs his hand down Marley's beige coat, and strokes the dog's tail, which isn't wagging now. John holds a rear paw, rubs Marley's shoulder, leans forward, and hugs his friend, burying his face in Marley's neck, then gently strokes Marley's head. Jenny waits tearfully at home as the vet puts a hypodermic into the IV line going into Marley's leg. Patrick slots a videotape into a player, and Jenny waves to the camera holding baby Patrick in a cowboy outfit. Marley stands expectantly next to the high chair, and Jenny slips him a tidbit. Patrick stares at the TV while at the surgery, the vet pushes down the plunger on the needle. John watches Marley, and Jenny sits sadly, staring into space. On the video, John takes off Patrick's nappy, which Marley then grabs, and Patrick grins, watching as his father tries to wrestle the nappy off the dog. Jenny sits sadly in the window seat as Patrick concentrates on the old video footage of his mother laughing and a close-up of Marley, staring puzzled into the camera. The vet puts a stethoscope to Marley's chest and listens; John continues to stroke Marley's head as the vet takes off the stethoscope and turns away. The Grogans walk across their leaf-strewn lawn, John carrying Colleen on his shoulders. He lifts down the little girl as they reach a small grave by a tree; she puts the picture in the grave, and he puts his paper in with Colleen's. She takes off her necklace, kneels down next to the grave, and drops the necklace in with Marley.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Lamps glow in the dwelling at nighttime, and he's reclining by the hearth. He reclines beside Marley as Jenny retrieves a quilt for them. Marley is resting beneath a tree, and he exits the vehicle and rushes indoors, where Connor offers him an embrace. Jenny suppresses sobs while John takes the plush lamb, and Patrick sorrowfully embraces Marley. The lad gazes beseechingly at his parents; Jenny scowls in compassion at her child's anguish, and John attempts a comforting grin. He carries Marley out to the automobile and tenderly places the elderly canine in the trunk. John proceeds to get behind the steering as Jenny tearfully caresses her terminal pet; she shuts the door and presses her palm to the pane as John drives away down the meandering path through trees decorated with golden brown fall foliage. At the clinic, John sits and waits with his hands clasped together. At home, Patrick is browsing through John's old columns, and Jenny enters and tousles his fair hair. Jenny manages her own sentiments as John yields to sobs. He returns to the clinic where Marley is resting on the table, runs his hand down Marley's tan coat, and caresses the dog's tail, which isn't wagging now. John holds a hind paw, massages Marley's shoulder, leans forward, and embraces his companion, burying his face in Marley's neck, then gently caresses Marley's head. Jenny waits tearfully at home as the veterinarian inserts a syringe into the IV line going into Marley's limb. Patrick inserts a videotape into a player, and Jenny waves to the camera holding infant Patrick in a cowboy costume. Marley stands expectantly beside the high chair, and Jenny slips him a morsel. Patrick gazes at the TV while at the clinic, the veterinarian depresses the plunger on the syringe. John observes Marley, and Jenny sits mournfully, gazing into nothingness. On the video, John removes Patrick's diaper, which Marley then snatches, and Patrick beams, watching as his father attempts to wrest the diaper from the dog. Jenny sits mournfully in the window seat as Patrick focuses on the old video recording of his mother laughing and a close-up of Marley, gazing bewildered into the camera. The veterinarian places a stethoscope to Marley's chest and listens; John continues to caress Marley's head as the veterinarian removes the stethoscope and turns aside. The Grogans stroll across their leaf-covered lawn, John carrying Colleen on his shoulders. He lowers the little girl as they arrive at a small tomb by a tree; she places the drawing in the grave, and he places his paper in with Colleen's. She removes her necklace, kneels beside the grave, and drops the necklace in with Marley.

A rear paw is held by John, Marley's shoulder is rubbed, forward is leaned by him, and his friend is hugged, his face buried into Marley's neck, then Marley's head is gently stroked by him. Marley is watched by John, and sitting sadly, space is stared into by Jenny. Sadly, the window seat is sat in by Jenny as the old video footage of his mother laughing and a close-up of Marley, puzzled staring into the camera, is concentrated on by Patrick. A stethoscope is put to Marley's chest by the vet and listened; Marley's head is continued to be stroked by John as the stethoscope is taken off by the vet and he turns away. Across their leaf-strewn lawn, the Grogans walk, Colleen is carried on his shoulders by John. The little girl is lifted down by him as a small grave by a tree is reached; the picture is put in the grave by her, and with Colleen's paper, it is put by him. Her necklace is taken off by her, kneeling down next to the grave, the necklace is dropped in with Marley.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Lights burn in the house at night as he lies by the fire with Marley. Jenny brings a blanket for them. Marley rests under a tree, and as he enters, Connor hugs him. Jenny fights tears while John holds a stuffed lamb, and Patrick hugs Marley. The boy looks pleadingly at his parents; Jenny shows sympathy and John offers a reassuring smile. He carries Marley to the car, gently placing the old dog in the trunk. John takes the wheel as Jenny strokes the dying pet, closing the door and pressing her hand to the glass as they drive away through a winding, leaf-covered path. At the vet's, John waits with clasped hands. At home, Patrick reads John's old columns, and Jenny enters, ruffling his hair. Jenny manages her emotions while John succumbs to tears. He returns to Marley, stroking the dog's motionless tail and gently hugging him. Jenny tearfully waits at home as the vet injects Marley's IV. Jenny holds back tears while John takes the stuffed lamb, and Patrick hugs Marley. The boy pleads with his parents; Jenny frowns, and John smiles reassuringly. test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
As the night unfolds, the lights throughout the house glow warmly, casting a serene ambiance as he lies by the crackling fire. He settles in comfortably next to Marley while Jenny thoughtfully retrieves a cozy blanket to cover them with. Marley, who had been resting peacefully under a tree, is the center of attention as he gets out of the car, sprinting eagerly indoors where Connor welcomes him with a heartfelt hug. Meanwhile, Jenny bravely holds back her tears, observing as John carefully takes the cherished stuffed lamb in hand, while Patrick, overwhelmed with emotion, embraces Marley tenderly. The young boy gazes imploringly at his parents, his eyes filled with pleading; Jenny offers a frown filled with sympathy for her son's heartache, while John attempts to offer a reassuring, albeit strained, smile. Gently and with great care, he carries Marley to the car, softly laying the aging dog down in the trunk. John then makes his way to the driver's seat as Jenny, sorrowfully caressing her beloved, ailing pet, closes the car door and places her palm against the cold glass. She watches wistfully as John drives away, the car navigating the winding driveway flanked by trees adorned with the golden brown leaves of autumn.

At the veterinary surgery, John sits waiting anxiously, his hands clasped tightly together in apprehension. Back at home, Patrick is flipping through John's old newspaper columns with interest, while Jenny enters the room, playfully mussing his blonde hair. As Jenny valiantly keeps her own emotions in check, John eventually succumbs to his grief, allowing tears to flow freely. He returns to the surgery room where Marley lies still on the table, tenderly running his hand down Marley's soft beige coat, gently stroking the dog's now motionless tail. John takes hold of Marley's rear paw, rubbing the dog's shoulder with affection, before leaning down to embrace his loyal friend, pressing his face into Marley's neck for comfort, and delicately caressing Marley's head. Meanwhile, Jenny waits at home, her eyes filled with tears, as the vet inserts a hypodermic needle into the IV line attached to Marley's leg. Patrick slots a videotape into the player, seeing his mother wave at the camera while holding baby Patrick dressed adorably in a cowboy outfit. Marley, ever the opportunist, stands expectantly beside the high chair, happily accepting a tidbit from Jenny. As Patrick gazes intently at the television, the vet at the clinic pushes down on the plunger of the needle, and John observes Marley, while Jenny sits nearby, lost in melancholy reflection. On the screen, a scene unfolds where John humorously removes Patrick's nappy, only for Marley to snatch it away, with Patrick beaming at the amusing spectacle of his father attempting to retrieve the diaper from the playful dog. Jenny remains seated dejectedly in the window seat as Patrick focuses on the nostalgic video footage showing his mother laughing joyfully and a close-up of Marley, looking curiously at the camera. The vet listens to Marley's chest with a stethoscope, and John continues to gently stroke Marley's head, maintaining his presence by his side, as the vet removes the stethoscope and turns away, indicating the end has come. Following this, the Grogan family walks solemnly across their lawn, which is strewn with autumn leaves. John, carrying Colleen on his shoulders, gently lifts her down when they reach a small grave shaded by a tree. She places her drawing tenderly into the grave, followed by John who adds his own written piece alongside Colleen's. In a poignant gesture, she removes her necklace, lowering herself to her knees beside the grave, and allows the necklace to fall gently atop Marley as a final farewell.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As the calm and quiet night gracefully unfolds, the lights throughout the entirety of the house illuminate warmly, casting a serene and comforting ambiance as he lies by the crackling and gently popping fire. He settles in comfortably next to Marley, who is snuggled against him, while Jenny thoughtfully retrieves a cozy and warm blanket to cover them with, ensuring their comfort. Marley, who had been resting peacefully under a tree in the yard, becomes the center of attention when he quickly gets out of the car, sprinting eagerly indoors, where Connor welcomes him with open arms and a heartfelt hug. Meanwhile, Jenny bravely holds back her tears, observing the scene as John carefully takes the cherished stuffed lamb in his hand. Patrick, overwhelmed with emotions that surge through him, tenderly embraces Marley. The young boy gazes imploringly at his parents, his eyes filled with a pleading expression; Jenny offers a sympathetic frown filled with empathy for her son's heartache, while John attempts to offer a reassuring, albeit strained, smile of comfort. Gently and with great care, he carries Marley to the car, softly and lovingly laying the aging dog down in the trunk. John then makes his way to the driver's seat as Jenny, sorrowfully caressing her beloved and ailing pet, closes the car door and places her palm against the cold glass of the window. She watches wistfully as John drives away, the car navigating the winding driveway flanked by trees adorned with the golden brown leaves of autumn, reflecting the change of seasons and emotions.

At the veterinary surgery, John sits waiting anxiously and nervously, his hands clasped tightly together in apprehension while thoughts swirl in his mind. Back at home, Patrick is flipping through John's old newspaper columns with keen interest, while Jenny enters the room and playfully musses his blonde hair affectionately. As Jenny valiantly keeps her own emotions in check, John eventually succumbs to his overwhelming grief, allowing tears to flow freely from his eyes. He returns to the surgery room where Marley lies still and quiet on the table, tenderly running his hand down Marley's soft and beige coat, gently stroking the dog's now motionless tail. John takes hold of Marley's rear paw, rubbing the dog's shoulder with affection and tenderness before leaning down to embrace his loyal and cherished friend, pressing his face into Marley's neck for comfort, and delicately caressing Marley's head. Meanwhile, Jenny waits at home with her heart heavy, her eyes filled with tears, as the vet inserts a hypodermic needle into the IV line attached to Marley's leg. Patrick slots a videotape into the player, watching his mother wave at the camera while holding baby Patrick, who is dressed adorably in a cowboy outfit. Marley, ever the opportunist, stands expectantly beside the high chair, happily accepting a tidbit from Jenny. As Patrick gazes intently at the television screen, the vet at the clinic pushes down on the plunger of the needle, and John observes Marley, while Jenny sits nearby, lost in melancholy reflection and memories. On the screen, a scene unfolds where John humorously removes Patrick's nappy, only for Marley to amusingly snatch it away, with Patrick beaming at the entertaining spectacle of his father attempting to retrieve the diaper from the playful dog. Jenny remains seated dejectedly in the window seat, as Patrick focuses on the nostalgic video footage that shows his mother laughing joyfully and a close-up of Marley, looking curiously at the camera. The vet listens to Marley's chest with a stethoscope, and John continues to gently stroke Marley's head, maintaining his unwavering presence by his side, as the vet removes the stethoscope and turns away, indicating the final moment has come. Following this heart-wrenching event, the Grogan family walks solemnly across their lawn, which is strewn with autumn leaves. John, thoughtfully carrying Colleen on his shoulders, gently lifts her down when they reach a small grave shaded by a tree. Colleen places her drawing tenderly into the grave as a token of love and remembrance, followed by John who adds his own written piece alongside Colleen's. In a poignant and heartfelt gesture, she removes her necklace, lowering herself to her knees beside the grave, and allows the necklace to fall gently atop Marley as a final farewell, honoring him one last time.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the evening unfolds, lights burn brightly inside the house against the night sky, casting a warm glow as he reclines by the comforting fire. In a tender moment, he settles down next to Marley, while Jenny busily attends to their comfort by fetching a cozy blanket to cover them. Meanwhile, Marley rests quietly under a tree outside. As the scene shifts, he emerges from the car and hastens indoors where Connor eagerly greets him with a heartfelt hug. In a poignant moment, Jenny battles her emotions, holding back tears as John gently takes hold of the stuffed lamb, and Patrick wraps his arms around Marley in a tearful embrace. The boy gazes pleadingly at his parents, seeking solace, while Jenny's face reflects her deep empathy for her son's sorrow, and John attempts to offer comfort with a reassuring smile. With tender care, he scoops Marley up and carefully places the old dog in the boot of the car. As John makes his way to the driver's seat, Jenny leans in to tenderly stroke her beloved pet, her eyes brimming with tears. She closes the door with a heavy heart and places her hand against the glass, watching wistfully as John drives away along the winding driveway lined with trees adorned in the golden brown hues of autumn leaves. Once they arrive at the surgery, John waits, his hands clasped tightly in anxious anticipation. At home, Patrick finds solace in reading through John's old columns, and Jenny enters, affectionately ruffling his blonde hair. Despite her own tumultuous emotions, Jenny maintains composure as John succumbs to his grief, shedding tears. Gathering himself, he returns to the surgery where Marley lies on the table, running his hand gently along Marley's beige coat and affectionately stroking the dog's now-still tail. John holds Marley's rear paw, tenderly rubs the dog's shoulder, then leans forward to embrace Marley, burying his face in the dog's neck before gently stroking Marley's head one last time. As Jenny waits, her heart heavy and her eyes moist with tears at home, the vet administers a hypodermic into the IV line situated in Marley's leg. Patrick, in an attempt to distract himself, slots a videotape into the player. On the screen, Jenny waves to the camera, holding baby Patrick dressed adorably in a cowboy outfit. Marley stands expectantly beside the high chair, and Jenny slyly slips him a morsel. Patrick is engrossed by the images on TV, while in contrast, at the surgery, the vet presses down the plunger on the needle. John watches Marley with a heavy heart, while Jenny sits, lost in sadness, staring into the void. The video continues to play, showing John removing Patrick's nappy, only for Marley to mischievously grab it, prompting a smile from Patrick as he watches his father playfully wrestle with the spirited dog. Jenny sits in solitude at the window seat, her thoughts consumed by the memories playing in the old footage—her own laughter and a close-up of Marley gazing perplexedly into the camera. The vet listens to Marley's chest with a stethoscope, his demeanor somber as John continues to gently stroke Marley's head. The vet removes the stethoscope and turns away, acknowledging the finality of the moment. In the aftermath, the Grogans tread slowly across their leaf-strewn lawn, John carrying Colleen on his shoulders. Upon reaching a small grave under a tree, he carefully lowers the little girl, allowing her to place a picture lovingly into the grave. John accompanies this gesture by adding his paper to Colleen's offering. In a final act of remembrance, Colleen removes her necklace, kneels by the grave, and drops it in with Marley, an enduring symbol of their love and farewell.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
At night, the house is aglow as he lies by the fire next to Marley, while Jenny brings a blanket for them. After Marley is gently placed in the car, Connor gives a comforting hug. Jenny, holding back tears, watches as John gathers the stuffed lamb, and Patrick hugs Marley with teary eyes. As their son looks to his parents for comfort, Jenny frowns empathetically, and John attempts a reassuring smile. He carefully places Marley in the car, then, with a heavy heart, drives away through the autumn-adorned trees, Jenny pressing her hand to the glass in silent farewell.

At the veterinary surgery, John waits somberly, hands clasped, while at home, Patrick browses through John's old columns, and Jenny affectionately ruffles his hair. She maintains her composure as John's tears flow freely. Returning to Marley, John affectionately strokes his unmoving tail and furry coat, holding a paw, and embracing his beloved dog.

Meanwhile, Jenny waits in teary anticipation at home as the vet administers the injection. Patrick watches an old video of a younger Jenny with baby Patrick, Marley expectantly beside the high chair. As Patrick focuses on the video, Jenny sadly contemplates the past.

In the video, John wrestles with Marley over Patrick's nappy, bringing smiles to their faces. Jenny remains seated, lost in thoughts, while watching the footage of Marley on TV. Back at the surgery, the vet listens to Marley's chest, and John lovingly strokes his head as the vet concludes the examination.

Later, the Grogans walk across their lawn, John carrying Colleen on his shoulders. Reaching a small grave by a tree, he sets Colleen down to place a picture, followed by his paper. She kneels to add her necklace, offering a heartfelt farewell to Marley.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Lights burn in the house at night, and he's lying by the fire that crackles softly, offering comfort against the chilly night. He lies down next to Marley, the family's beloved Labrador retriever known for his boundless energy in his younger years, as Jenny fetches a blanket for them. Marley is lying under a tree in their backyard, a spot he loved for its cool shade, and he gets out of the car and runs indoors, where Connor, Marley's favorite human playmate since puppyhood, gives him a hug. Jenny fights back tears while John takes the stuffed lamb, an old toy that Marley would often carry around, and Patrick tearfully hugs Marley. The boy looks imploringly at his parents; Jenny frowns in sympathy at her son's pain, understanding the depth of a child's bond with their pet, and John tries a reassuring smile. He carries Marley out to the car and gently lays the old dog down in the boot, a journey they've dreaded but knew was inevitable. John goes to get behind the wheel as Jenny tearfully strokes her dying pet; she closes the door and presses her hand to the glass, feeling the cold separation as John drives away down the winding drive through trees adorned with golden brown autumn leaves, marking the season of change. At the surgery, a local veterinarian clinic known for its compassionate care, John sits and waits with his hands clasped together. At home, Patrick is leafing through John's old columns, a collection of articles that once chronicled the humorous and heartwarming tales of Marley, and Jenny walks in and ruffles his blonde hair. Jenny controls her own emotions as John gives into tears. He goes back into the surgery where Marley is lying on the table, runs his hand down Marley's beige coat, now dulled with age, and strokes the dog's tail, which isn't wagging now, a heart-wrenching sign of his weakened state. John holds a rear paw, rubs Marley's shoulder, leans forward, and hugs his friend, burying his face in Marley's neck, then gently strokes Marley's head, remembering the countless hours of companionship. Jenny waits tearfully at home as the vet puts a hypodermic into the IV line going into Marley's leg, a humane way to ease his suffering. Patrick slots a videotape into a player, watching footage captured during happier times, and Jenny waves to the camera holding baby Patrick in a cowboy outfit, a Halloween scene from years past. Marley stands expectantly next to the high chair, and Jenny slips him a tidbit, a common act of love in their household. Patrick stares at the TV while at the surgery, the vet pushes down the plunger on the needle. John watches Marley, and Jenny sits sadly, staring into space, lost in memories. On the video, John takes off Patrick's nappy, which Marley then grabs, showcasing his playful mischief, and Patrick grins, watching as his father tries to wrestle the nappy off the dog. Jenny sits sadly in the window seat as Patrick concentrates on the old video footage of his mother laughing and a close-up of Marley, staring puzzled into the camera, an immortalized moment of his curious nature. The vet puts a stethoscope to Marley's chest and listens; John continues to stroke Marley's head as the vet takes off the stethoscope and turns away, signaling the end of Marley's suffering. The Grogans walk across their leaf-strewn lawn, John carrying Colleen, his youngest child, on his shoulders. He lifts down the little girl as they reach a small grave by a tree; she puts the picture in the grave, a drawing she had made for Marley, and he puts his paper in with Colleen's, a tribute to the life they shared. She takes off her necklace, kneels down next to the grave, and drops the necklace in with Marley, a symbol of her love and farewell.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Lights burn in the house at night and he is lying by the fire. He lies down next to Marley as Jenny fetches a blanket for them. Marley is lying under a tree and he gets out of the car and runs indoors where Connor gives him a hug. Jenny fights back tears while John takes the stuffed lamb and Patrick tearfully hugs Marley. The boy looks imploringly at his parents. Jenny frowns in sympathy at her son's pain and John tries a reassuring smile. He carries Marley out to the car and gently lays the old dog down in the boot. John goes to get behind the wheel as Jenny tearfully strokes her dying pet. she closes the door and presses her hand to the glass as John drives away down the winding drive through trees adorned with golden brown autumn leaves. At the surgery John sits and waits with his hands clasped together. At home Patrick is leafing through John's old columns and Jenny walks in and ruffles his blonde hair. Jenny controls her own emotions as John gives into tears. He goes back into the surgery where Marley is lying on the table runs his hand down Marley's beige coat and strokes the dog's tail which is not wagging now. John holds a rear paw rubs Marley's shoulder leans forward and hugs his friend burying his face in Marley's neck then gently strokes Marley's head. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. Jenny waits tearfully at home as the vet puts a hypodermic into the IV line going into Marley's leg. Patrick slots a videotape into a player and Jenny waves to the camera holding baby Patrick in a cowboy outfit. Marley stands expectantly next to the high chair and Jenny slips him a tidbit. Patrick stares at the TV while at the surgery the vet pushes down the plunger on the needle. John watches Marley and Jenny sits sadly staring into space. On the video John takes off Patrick's nappy which Marley then grabs and Patrick grins watching as his father tries to wrestle the nappy off the dog. Jenny sits sadly in the window seat as Patrick concentrates on the old video footage of his mother laughing and a closeup of Marley staring puzzled into the camera. The vet puts a stethoscope to Marley's chest and listens. John continues to stroke Marley's head as the vet takes off the stethoscope and turns away. The Grogans walk across their leafstrewn lawn. John carrying Colleen on his shoulders. He lifts down the little girl as they reach a small grave by a tree. she puts the picture in the grave and he puts his paper in with Colleen's. She takes off her necklace kneels down next to the grave and drops the necklace in with Marley.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The lanterns flicker in the tower at dawn, and she's perched by the stove. She lounges next to Bruno as Carla retrieves a scarf for them. Bruno is jumping over a shrub, and she steps out of the train and dives outdoors, where Angelo hands her a sandwich. Carla suppresses giggles while Tom grabs the plush bear, and Olivia cheerfully pats Bruno. The girl gazes suspiciously at her siblings; Carla smirks in confusion at her daughter's joy, and Tom makes a puzzled frown. She drags Bruno into the train and quickly tosses the young cat down in the trunk. Tom strolls to hop behind the bike as Carla joyfully tickles her laughing kitten; she opens the gate and throws her hat to the air as Tom speeds away down the narrow lane through fields dotted with verdant green spring flowers. At the bakery, Tom stands and paces with his arms open wide. At the park, Olivia is skating through Tom's old drawings, and Carla skips over and pats her curly head. Carla ignores her own concerns as Tom gives in to chuckles. He returns to the bakery where Bruno is perched on the stool, pats his hands over Bruno's orange fur, and tickles the cat's whiskers, which aren't twitching now. Tom holds a front paw, shakes Bruno's ear, leans back, and tickles his buddy, burying his face in Bruno's mane, then quietly pats Bruno's back. Carla waits happily at the park as the baker pulls a muffin into the oven rack going next to Bruno's tray. Olivia inserts a disc into a console, and Carla claps to the music holding tiny Olivia in a pirate costume. Bruno hops eagerly below the rocking chair, and Carla tosses him a morsel. Olivia squints at the radio while at the bakery, the baker pulls up the lever on the coffee. Tom observes Bruno, and Carla stands happily, glancing into the sky. On the broadcast, Tom removes Olivia's hat, which Bruno then snatches, and Olivia beams, watching as her dad attempts to recover the hat from the cat. Carla stands happily on the porch swing as Olivia inspects the fresh broadcast footage of her dad chuckling and a close-up of Bruno, gazing curious into the radio. The baker hands a thermometer to Bruno's ear and checks; Tom continues to pat Bruno's back as the baker hands off the thermometer and turns around. The Grogans dance across their flower-decked driveway, Tom bouncing Felicia on his head. He lowers the young boy as they touch a wide pond by a bench; he tosses the note in the pond, and she places her pen in with Felicia's. He takes off his ring, sits down below the pond, and places the ring in with Bruno.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Lights burn at night as John lies by the fire with Marley, their dog, while Jenny fetches a blanket. When Marley is found under a tree, John takes him in, embraced by his son Connor. Jenny and Patrick bid tearful farewells, with Jenny showing sympathy for her son's pain, while John tries to comfort them. John gently places Marley in the car, with Jenny stroking the ailing dog before he drives away through autumn-colored trees. At the vet's, John waits solemnly. At home, Patrick revisits John's old columns, and Jenny tries to hold back her emotions, while John succumbs to tears at the surgery. He tenderly strokes and hugs Marley one last time. Jenny waits emotionally at home, and a videotape plays showing fond memories with Marley and Patrick. The vet administers the final injection, and John continues to stroke Marley. The Grogans later walk across their yard, with John carrying Colleen. They reach Marley's grave, where Colleen places a picture and her necklace in the grave, bidding a heartfelt goodbye.
